_meanings:
{@--4@} Love or desire of sensual 
enjoyments, considered as one of the
ends of life ({#puruzArTa#}); <ab>cf.</ab> {#arTa#} {8} and
{#arTakAma#}.

{@--1@} Object of desire.
{@--2@} Semen virile. [Kāma is the Cupid
of the Hindu mythology-the son of
Kṛṣṇa and Rukmi{%ni%}. His wife is Rati.
When the gods wanted a commander for
their forces in their war with Tāraka,
they sought the aid of Kāma in drawing
the mind of Śiva towards Pārvatī, whose
issue alone could vanquish the demon.
Kāma undertook the mission; but Śiva,
being offended at the disturbance of his
penance, burnt him down with the fire
of his third eye. Subsequently he was
allowed by Śiva to be born again in the
form of Pradyumna at the request of
Rati. His intimate friend is Vasanta or
the spring; and his son is Aniruddha.
He is armed with a bow and arrows-the
bow-string being a line of bees, and 
arrows flowers of five different plants].

{1} a fire of love, 
violent or ardent love.

the influence of
love or desire.

suppression of passion or desire,
stoicism.

an epithet of
Aniruddha, son of Pradyumna.

{1} arrow
of the god of love.

overcome
with love or desire, impassioned,
lustful.

striving to obtain
a desired object.

{2} a voluntary libation of water to
deceased friends exclusive of those
who are entitled to it by law;  
<ls>Y. 3. 4.</ls>

affected by or 
overcome with passion.

<ab>N.</ab> of
Rati, the wife of Kāma.

following the dictates of love
or passion.

acting at will,
indulging one's desires.

{1} acting at will, acting as
one likes.

going of one's own accord, able 

to act or move as one likes.

able to go to any desired
place; <ls>R. 13. 76.</ls>

moving freely
or unrestrained, wandering at
will; <ls>Ku. 1. 50.</ls>

produced by passion or 
desire; <ls>Ms. 7. 46</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 7.">47</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 7.">50.</ls>

fulfilling a desire,
granting a request or desire.

an
epithet of Skanda and of Śiva.

a fabulous cow
yielding all desires; <ls>Bg. 10. 28.</ls>

a species
of the mango tree.

a festival of
the god of love celebrated on the
full-moon day in the month of
Chaitra.

(pl) a district 
lying in the east of Bengal (the 
western portion of Assam); <ls>R. 4. 83</ls>,
<ls n="R. 4.">84.</ls>

‘showing heroism at will,’
an epithet of Garuḍa.

addicted to sensual gratification, 
licentious, dissipated; <ls>Ms. 5. 154.</ls>

the
science of love, erotic science.

{1} <ab>N.</ab> of an erotic work by
Vātsyāyana.

produced by mere desire without any
real cause; <ls>Bg. 16. 8.</ls>
